Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
Thank you for considering LegalZoom for your Intellectual Property needs.
If you are interested in submitting a color mark for your trademark application, please reply to this e-mail and provide the following information:
(1) A color claim naming the colors that are a feature of the mark; and (2) a separate statement describing where the color(s) appear on the mark. A color drawing will not be published without these statements.
For example, a properly worded color claim would read as follows:
The color(s) <name the color(s)> are claimed as a distinctive feature of the mark.
For example, a properly worded description would read as follows:
The color(s) <name the color(s)> appear in <specify portion of mark on which color(s) appear>.
If the color claim or description is unclear or ambiguous, the examining attorney will require clarification. The written description of the mark must include a generic description of the color, in addition to a reference to the commercial color identification system.
For further information on color marks, please visit the following link: http://www.uspto.gov/web/offices/tac/notices/examguide1-03.htm#IB1
